page.title: 18GATEFORTH HALL
page.content: The Hall was built in 1812 as a hunting lodge by Sir Humphrey Brooke Osbaldeston.The hall had 2005 acres of land around it.It later became a T.B.Hospital which was owned by Leeds Area Health Authority.In 1978 it was bought by auction by Mr.C.Henry and was made back into a hall.Mr.Henry planned to make a hotel and leisure centre but he sold it to Mr.D.Barnett in 1983.The hall has 60 rooms one of which is 10 degrees colder than any other room and yet it has 3 inside walls.This room is where the legendary Grey Lady slept who is the ghost of the hall.Gateforth hall is now a restaurant and Mr.Barnett is hoping to make it into a hotel which will cost around 1/4 million pounds.
